title: Trump and Putin Put on a Show in Summit, but No Ukraine Deal Emerges
summary: President Trump gave President Vladimir Putin a warm public reception, effectively ending his diplomatic isolation over the past three years for his invasion of Ukraine. But Mr. Putin did not agree to stop the war.

title: At Trump’s Summit, No Deal on Ukraine, and No Consequence for Putin
summary: President Trump’s failure to reach an accord on Ukraine only made his warm welcome for the Russian leader more striking.

title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s Meeting With Putin
summary: While no deal was announced, the Russian leader secured some wins and left on good terms with the U.S. president.

title: Trump Administration Backs Off New Attempt to Widen Control of D.C. Police
summary: The chief will remain after a lawsuit challenged the Justice Department’s attempt to install a new leader as part of an effort to put the agency under federal control.

title: Trump Depicted Youth Crime in D.C. as Rampant. Here’s What the Data Shows.
summary: Concerns came to a head during the pandemic, when carjackings surged and many of those arrested were children. Carjackings and other crimes have declined considerably.

title: Officers Clear More Homeless People from Sites Around Washington
summary: Local police now under federal oversight dismantled encampments, discarding tents and other belongings.

title: Trump Is Testing D.C.’s Home Rule. What Is It?
summary: The city’s limited self-governance has set the stage for the president’s police takeover.

title: California Lawmakers Release a Proposed House Map Favoring Democrats
summary: The plan would help Democrats flip five seats, offsetting the gains Republicans hope to make by redrawing maps in Texas.

title: Newsom’s Gerrymander of California Has a Formidable Foe: Schwarzenegger
summary: The actor-turned-governor helped overhaul how California draws political maps. In an interview with The New York Times, he said he would fight to preserve that legacy.

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX Most Likely Doesn’t Pay Taxes
summary: Elon Musk’s rocket company relies on federal contracts, but years of losses have most likely let it avoid paying federal income taxes, according to internal company documents.

title: For Some Venetians, This Overgrown Island Is Paradise
summary: A citizens’ group is now in charge of the island of Poveglia, where they will create a park for anyone who wants to leave Venice’s maddening crowds of tourists behind.

title: Once Seen as Divisive, South Korea’s New Leader Tries for Charming
summary: To South Koreans weary of the political polarization that led briefly to martial law, President Lee Jae Myung is showing a more human touch than his predecessor. But his biggest challenges lie ahead.

title: Judge Rejects Trump’s Attempt to End Standards of Care for Detained Migrant Children
summary: Court-mandated oversight will remain in place for migrant children in custody. Lawyers have reported poor medical care and lack of sunlight and showers.

title: MAHA Draft Report Brings Relief to Some, Chagrin to Others
summary: A draft of an upcoming White House report on children’s health was not as harsh toward the agriculture industry as some of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s allies had hoped.

title: Air Canada’s Flight Attendants Reject Call for Arbitration
summary: Ahead of the work stoppage, the airline said it had canceled most of the 700 flights that it directly operates, which carry about 130,000 people each day.

title: The Air Canada Strike: Here’s What to Know About Flight Cancellations and More
summary: The carrier’s flight attendants are now on strike, disrupting plans for 130,000 travelers a day. Here’s what to know if your flight is affected.

title: How Train Riders With Disabilities Are Faring on Amtrak
summary: Passengers are facing blocked wheelchair space, getting stuck in doors and suffering other indignities 35 years after the Americans With Disabilities Act became law.

title: How Accessible Is Traveling by Amtrak?
summary: Many people with disabilities depend on Amtrak to travel across the country, but the journey can still present obstacles. Gabe Castro-Root outlines some of the challenges disabled passengers encounter while traveling.

title: Mayor LaToya Cantrell of New Orleans Is Indicted on Corruption Charges
summary: LaToya Cantrell was charged with going to criminal lengths to carry out, and cover up, a romantic relationship with a city police officer assigned to protect her.

title: Two Decades of Putin Playing the West
summary: For more than 20 years, Western leaders have played right into Putin’s hands — and given one a shake.

title: Putin Probably Bought Himself More Time for His War in Ukraine
summary: Few East-West meetings have ended with less clarity than Friday’s Trump-Putin summit in Alaska. What was clear, though, was that Vladimir Putin was well satisfied.

title: NY Weed Dispensaries Sue Regulators Over Misinterpretation of State Rules
summary: Last month, dozens of cannabis businesses were told they were located too close to schools after state officials realized they had misinterpreted regulations.

title: Judge Blocks F.T.C. Investigation of Media Matters
summary: The agency began looking into the liberal watchdog group’s research critical of Elon Musk and his social media platform, X, in May.

title: Tommy McLain, the King of Swamp Pop, Dies at 85
summary: Playing a blend of rock, R&B and zydeco, he had a hit in 1966 with “Sweet Dreams” and inspired Elvis Costello, Nick Lowe and many others.

title: Priscilla Presley Locked in Feud With Former Business Partners
summary: Elvis’s ex-wife has traded lawsuits in a financial dispute with former advisers that has grown ugly with an allegation that she prematurely “pulled the plug” on her late daughter, Lisa Marie.
